description: Change of Use from Shop (Class A1) to Residential (Class C3) and associated works
decision_conditions: The proposal would fail to satisfy Condition M2-(1)(a) of schedule 2, Part 3, Class M of the 2015 General Permitted Development Order (as amended) as it would have an unacceptable adverse immpact upon transport and highways.  The proposed development is considered to prejudice highway safety and is likely to lead to sporadic, inconsiderate and illegal parking on roads in the vicinity of the site, thereby also failing to comply with Policies DM9 and DM10 of the Council's LDF Core Strategy, 2012.

The proposal would fail to satisfy Condition M2-(1)(e) of schedule 2, Part 3, Class M of the 2015 General Permitted Development Order (as amended) as the proposed design and external appearance of the building would be unacceptable.The proposed windows and openings on Acre Road would be visually incongruous and out of character with the application site and the surrounding area, thereby conflicting with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012.

The proposal would fail to satisfy Condition M2-(1)(d)(i) and (ii) as it would be undesirable for the building to change to a use falling within Class C3 (dwellinghouses) because of the impact of the change of use on the adequate provision of services of the sort that may be provided by a building falling within Class A1 and on the sustainability of that shopping area.  The proposal would also conflict with Policy CS12 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012 as it would fail to maintain the attractive and distinctive character of Kingston Town Centre, through the implementation of the Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan (K+20)  and conflict with Policy K2 of the Kingston Town Centre Area Action Plan, 2008 (K+20) which seeks to control the use of premises in shopping streets to safeguard and enhance the vitality and viability of Kingston Town Centre.  The site forms part of a designated "other frontage".
The RBK Urban Design Officer is satisfied with the information provided and recommends that condition 4.02 (Key Design Details - new foul drainage excavations) can be fully discharged.

The assessment of this application has been based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.
Representations - two letters have been received raising the following summarised concerns: - Effects on trees; and- Incorrect block plan.

Further to my previous email, please complete the correct form as well as submit required documentation and fee.Please note that this Listed Building application has be invalidated until the required FUL application has been submitted.

This should be clearly shown on plans (The plans to only show/indicate the changes proposed for this application). Please amend application form to reflect.Please also amend drawings to clearly show the amendments for this application and resubmit.
